events.name: Our First GCPUG Meetup!
events.description:
Our first meetup will be at the Google Fiber building in downtown Austin. We'll get to meet each other, say hi, grab some pizza and drinks, and talk about GCP!

Here is our content agenda for the Meetup:

1) What's New!? Custom Machine Types, New Console UI

2) Overview of GCP Services

3) Community-driven session to plan future meetups, concepts, topics and speakers, etc.

Parking information:

Parking is available on the street and in various nearby parking garages at various price ranges, but there are no designated spots for Google Fiber. 

Nearby Garages:

LAZ Parking Lot (next to FRANK)

171 W 4th St

Austin, Texas 78701

3 min walk - 2 blocks north

AMLI Downtown Garage

201 Lavaca Street

Austin, TX 78701

2 min walk - 1 block west

Ashton 101 Colorado Underground Parking

140 W Cesar Chavez St

Austin, TX 78701, USA

1 min walk - across the street south

Hospitality Parking Garage

200 W Cesar Chavez St

Austin, TX 78701

1 min walk - diagonal from Fiber Space southwest

Looking forward to seeing y'all on Thursday for our first GCPUG Austin Meetup!

events.name: Discuss Load Balancing on GCP

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
Greetings,

We're kicking off 2016 with a great meetup focused on Load Balancing within GCP, the highest voted topic from last time. Lou and I will again present what's new and notable with GCP. While we don't yet have a sponsor, expect the usual victuals—pizza and drinks.

WHEN: Weds, January 13th, 2016 at 7:00 PM.

WHERE: 2nd Floor in the Google UP35 Building (3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722). The doors and elevators will be unlocked and allow access to the 2nd floor. There will be plenty of on-site parking.

Cheers,

-- Jason
events.how_to_find_us: We'll meet on the 2nd floor. Take the elevators up.

events.name: Kubernetes+Google Container Engine!

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
In this session, we will plan to cover Kubernetes, the open-source container cluster manager that was developed by Google. Leading contributors now include companies such as RedHat, Microsoft, intel, Huawei, eBay, and many others. Kubernetes handles scheduling onto nodes in a compute cluster and actively manages workloads to ensure that their state matches the users declared intentions. Google Container Engine is essentially a managed Kubernetes. We'll plan on having expert speakers from Google as well as feature some current users in the community.

As usual, there will be beer+pizza, woohoo! Plenty of parking in the garage or on the street near the building, be sure to head up to Level 2 and collect a name tag from the lobby. 

Looking forward to it, all!

events.name: Recap of GCP Next Event

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
Hey y'all! Greetings from your friendly meetup organizers. For this meetup, we will focus on a recap of GCP Next, Google Cloud's annual user group event which featured 3,000+ attendees this year in San Francisco.

We will be reviewing the long list of announcements, "what's new", ranging from everything from new regions and zones, plans for the future to new monitoring, logging and big data products. 

Come to the 2nd floor, and, always, there will be pizza and beer!

p.s. There's plenty of parking available in the garage!

p.p.s. In case you are wondering "why only 1 week notice" it is because I was haggling with Facilities and the building over use of the space. Finally got it confirmed this morning.

p.p.p.s Also, we are going to try and make this time (3rd Wednesday @ 7pm) a recurring time, likely every other month.

Feel free to reach out if you have any questions! Looking forward to seeing y'all there!
events.how_to_find_us: Same building as Longhorn Network!

events.name: Big Data Programming

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
Hello GCP Gurus!

Our next GCP user group will be on Big Data Programming. We are staying unintentionally faithful to our initial list of topics and are following the order of interest precisely. 

We will discuss the tools and solutions available in Google Cloud Platform to support the lifecycle of storage and analysis of data-centric workloads. We'll touch on object storage, SQL/NoSQL, data warehousing, large-scale analytics, real-time streaming architectures, and more! (Maybe not all of those things, but at least a good chunk of them).

As always, there will be pizza and beer, and, as always, there will be plenty of parking in the garage. 

If anyone gets stuck, please text/call me (Zach) at[masked]!

Regards,

Zach, Jason and Lou

Google Cloud Platform
events.how_to_find_us: Same building as Longhorn Network!

events.name: Building Microservices on K8S/GCE/GKE

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
Greetings,

We invite you to join us on Aug 17th at 7:00 PM, to learn about Building Microservices on GCE with Kubernetes (K8S) and GKE.

We have access to Google- and non-Google-experts on the topic. And, given the conviviality of our previous microservice-based application and architecture conversations, we expect this to be a very fun meeting.

We'll meet at the usual place and time:

WHEN: 08/17/2016 at 7:00 PM

WHERE: Google UP35, 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor, Austin, TX. There's plenty of free parking.

Cheers,

--Jason
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the 2nd floor. Take the elevator up.

events.name: Lightning Talks: Howtos, Pitfalls to Avoid and Interesting Implementations

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
Hello GCP Gurus!

We've been doing all the talking for the last few months, now it's your turn to be heard.  Share your howtos, pitfalls to avoid and interesting implementations with the group.  Email us with your topic and you could be the star of the show!  As an added bonus, every speaker will be given some great swag from Google (see picture below).  We have books and other great items that you can show off to your friends and colleagues.   We will let you pick your prize based on the order you submit your talk.  So hurry and get those talks to us ASAP!

But that is not all!  we will also be giving away the remaining swag to the rest of the group based on your RSVP date.  So don't delay!

Lightning Talks should be limited to 10 minutes max.  

Thanks and can't wait to see you at the meetup!

Lou, Jason and Zach

Google Cloud Platform

events.name: Highlights of Google Next 2017

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
Greetings,

It's time for another GCPUG meetup! 

This time, we'll be sharing highlights from the recent Google Next conference. A few of us went and have stories and news to share.

We'll also be announcing some improvements to the group. Come see what's up. :-)

And, as usual there's plenty of parking, pizza, and drinks.

See you soon,

-- Jason
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the 2nd floor. Head to the elevators or chat with the security guard for help.

events.name: Let's watch a fascinating Kubernetes talk by Kelsey Hightower
events.description:
GCP Gurus,

We're pleased to have Kelsey Hightower, a global Kubernetes tech celeb, speak at our pokey little meetup!

Due to the expected increase in attendance, we'll be moving the meetup to The Home Depot's Technology Center near Parmer and I-35. It's easy to find and there's tons of free parking. 

RSVP early as we're limiting registration to 90. (Edited: 110 total, 90 from this group.)

As usual, food will be provided.

Cheers,

—Jason

events.name: Learn how to get started with TensorFlow

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
GCP Gurus,

In our next meetup, I will present on how to get started with TensorFlow.

Since I'm no Kelsey Hightower and we won't need 120 chairs, we'll be hosting this meeting back at our old stomping ground, Google's UP35.

What: TensorFlow 101
When: Weds, Jun 14th at 7:00 PM
Where: Google UP35 (tons of free and easy parking)

Cheers,

—Jason
events.how_to_find_us: 2nd Floor, follow the smell of pizza and technology

events.name: Dataflow vs Dataproc- What's the difference?

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
GCP Gurus,

This month our guest speaker is Derek Remund, a Customer Reliability Engineer at Rackspace.  In this talk, he'll give an overview of two GCP Big Data platforms: Cloud Dataproc and Cloud Dataflow.  He'll provide an overview of each and demo real world use cases. He'll also explore the trade-offs of using fully managed cloud platforms vs sticking to open source tools you know and (maybe) love.

Come enjoy some BBQ and engage in a discussion of historical and technical context for these core components of Google’s big data platform.  We'll be at our usual haunt- Google UP35 office.

What: Dataproc vs Dataflow- What's the difference?
When: Wed, July 12th at 7:00 PM
Where: Google UP35 (tons of free and easy parking)

Hope to see you there!

-William
events.how_to_find_us: 2nd Floor, follow the smell of BBQ

events.name: Securing Kubernetes on GKE

venue.name: Google UP35
venue.address_1: 3300 N Interstate Hwy 35 Austin, TX 78722, 2nd Floor

events.description:
Our guest speaker this month is Brian Gosnell, an Architect at WP Engine. Brian will talk about running and securing untrusted workloads in Kubernetes and specifically on Google Container Engine (GKE). He will discuss securing and limiting pods, network isolation, cluster provisioning, RBAC, and practical patterns that can be used to reduce the exposure that applications have to the environment.

The meetup will be at our usual haunt, the Google UP35 office. Food and beer will be providing by WP Engine.

See you there!

-William
events.how_to_find_us: 2nd floor

events.name: Istio State of Mind: Service mesh and how it helps manage microservices
events.description:
As many companies transition from building monolithic to a microservice architecture, they find it gets more difficult to manage and understand the network connecting the “service mesh”. The key requirements such security, traffic control, resiliency, monitoring, metrics, and logging often becomes quite difficult in a microservice architecture. More complex requirements, such as A/B testing, canary releases, rate limiting, policy enforcement, access control, and end-to-end authentication become an even larger burden.  

Enter Istio. Istio is a new open source project launched by IBM, Google and Lyft, designed to connect, manage, and secure micro services. Istio solves many of these complex requirements, with the added bonus of not requiring a change to the application code. We will be going over what you can do with Istio and showing some demos of it in action on a kubernetes cluster. 

Food and drinks will be provided.
events.how_to_find_us: Screen shot attached

events.name: Monitoring your GCP applications with Stackdriver
events.description:
This month Amir Hermelin, GCP Product Manager, will talk about Stackdriver, how to use it to monitor your GCP (and AWS) applications, and what Stackdriver's future road map looks like.

In addition, Cher Simon, SRE Manager at The Home Depot, will talk about how The Home Depot used BigQuery to build an SLO framework for every microservice it deployed, called VALET (Volume, Availability, Latency, Errors, and Tickets).

Come join us at Google's new downtown office. You have to see it to believe it! 

As usual, food will be served.

Parking update: Google will provide you a voucher to park in a garage in their building. Here is a map where the garage is located with some photos of the entrance to the garage.
events.how_to_find_us: Google's NEW downtown office. 29th floor. More details on best location to park coming shortly

GCP Gurus,

We're delighted to announce our next meetup (2017/11/08 @ 7 PM), this time hosted by Volusion. We will meet at their campus and learn about how they're leveraging GCP to serve over 40,000 ecommerce websites. It's going to be a fantastic story!

As usual we'll provide food and drinks. Parking should be a breeze.

Location:
Volusion, LLC
    1835A Kramer Lane Suite 100, Austin, TX

We look forward to seeing you there,

-- Jason

events.name: Introduction to the Service Mesh, hosted by HomeAway and Buoyant Software
events.description:
Mark Tyrrell, Edge Architect at HomeAway, will provide an introduction to the service mesh and how HomeAway is using Linkerd in production.

William Morgan and Oliver Gould, co-founders of Buoyant, the company behind Linkerd, will talk abut what's new and exciting with Linkerd.

The meetup is being hosted at HomeAway's Domain office. Food and drink will be provided.

This looks like it will be one of our most interesting meetups yet. Looking forward to seeing y'all there!
-William
events.how_to_find_us: The HomeAway office is right across from Whole Foods/Chase Bank, on the 3rd floor. Please park in the Blue Garage.

events.name: Pivotal Labs GCP Roadmap and The Home Depot’s deployment of PCF on GCP
events.description:
Our first meetup of 2018 will focus on Pivotal and their platforms running on GCP. In the first part of the talk, Dustin Bennet from The Home Depot will discuss a large production deployment of Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF) to GCP, enabling Home Depot applications running in PCF on-premises to easily migrate to GCP.

In the second part of the talk, Ed Mikuszewski from Pivotal labs will discuss Pivotal’s GCP Roadmap for PCF, Pivotal Kubernetes Service (PKS), and Pivotal Functions.

It’s been awhile since we met at the Google Fiber office downtown, but it has a great conference venue. Please park in parking garage right across the street: Ashton 101 Colorado Underground Parking
140 W Cesar Chavez St
Austin, TX 78701

We will give you a pre-paid parking pass at the Meetup.

We are working on many exciting meetups in 2018. You can expect 12 solid meetups next year, plus more.

-William
events.how_to_find_us: Please park at Ashton 101 Colorado Underground Parking 140 W Cesar Chavez St.

events.name: RetailMeNot Innovating on GCP
events.description:
The RetailMeNot Labs group is a small team with a big mission: "Discover new, easy ways to save consumers money." Part of this discovery means doing a lot of rapid prototyping and testing, often at scale with RetailMeNot's audience. As such, they place a premium on efficient, scalable, and ergonomic tools and platforms. Naturally, GKE (Google Kubernetes Engine) stood out as good fit. In this talk, Shaun and Tom will discuss how their team leverages GCP, Kubernetes, Gitlab, and their own tools to ensure RetailMeNot stays on the cutting edge of savings.

Shaun Dubuque: Veteran Software Engineer that has been with the Labs team from the start and now leads their engineering efforts.
Tom Dickman: Senior Software Engineer on RetailMeNot’s Labs team. He’s passionate about using Kubernetes to enable rapid application development.

The Meetup will be hosted at RetailMeNot’s office. Parking:
* Please park in the Frost Bank Tower (guest parking) accessible from 4th Street. We will provide parking vouchers. Walk over to 301 Congress and head to the 4th Floor.

Note: we moved this Meetup to the second Tuesday of the month to avoid Valentine’s Day. In March we will return back to second Wednesday’s of the month.
events.how_to_find_us: Park in the Frost Bank Tower Guest Parking by entering from 4th Street. Walk across 4th Street between the two buildings and enter 301 Congress. Go to the 4th floor.

events.name: IWD: Women Techmakers Innovating on GCP
events.description:
Confirmed Speakers:
* Christine Doig (Datna, LLC)
* Kayla Matteo (The Home Depot)
* Nicole (WP Engine)

events.name: GCP Network performance tuning with Colt McAnlis
events.description:
We’re excited to have Colt mcAnlis speak at our Meetup in April. In case you don’t know, Colt has a series of videos that walk you through performance tuning of all aspects of the Google Cloud Platform. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLIivdWyY5sqK5zce0-fd1Vam7oPY-s_8X

In this Meetup, he’ll cover tuning the GCP network stack from basics to advanced:

Basics: Latency/Physics, CPU sizing, internal / external IP

Intermediates: LB, LB CDN/Caching

Advanced : TCPBBR, Network Tiers, TCP Windowing,

The Meetup will be help at the google office. Parking will be at your own expense but there’s plenty available nearby. Food and beer will be provided.

You don't want to miss this one!

events.name: GDG Cloud Austin - May Meetup - Kubernetes 101 & 201
events.description:
Join us for an evening of networking and learning about Kubernetes on GCP.

Ward Harold, from Google, will go over a Kubernetes 101 talk. Then, Victor Trac, from CloudKite, will take it a step further with Kubernetes 201.

Google HR will be providing some very tasty food and talking about their current opportunities. (We're aiming for amazing BBQ, but we'll see.)

Please note that WeWork requires all attendees check in with a valid photo ID. You can provide your name when you RSVP.

Location:
WeWork at University Park
3300 N Interstate 35 Austin, TX 78705
7th Floor Common Area
events.how_to_find_us: This Meetup is at the WeWork on the 7th floor.

events.name: GDG Cloud Austin - June Meetup
events.description:
This month we'll hear from coder.com. Coder is bringing the power of Google Cloud to the IDE. Coder will speak to how we implement stateful services, distributed locking over BigTable, autoscaling via StackDriver metrics, and more.

Yay!—Google HR is our confirmed sponsor for June! In exchange for super-tasty food and free swag, they will spend a few minutes discussing current openings and hang around to meet anyone interested into talking to a Google Cloud recruiter.

Note: We will have free parking passes to hand out. Feel free to park in the Google building downtown.
events.how_to_find_us: FREE PARKING IN THE GOOGLE BUILDING: Park in the garage and head down to the first floor. The guard will help you from there.

events.name: Give Your Business a Voice: Use Cases for Dialogflow
events.description:
One of the newest additions to the Google Cloud Platform, Dialogflow is the technology that powers the Google Assistant. Using Dialogflow, you can create rich voice and chat experiences that enable your customers to get things done using the API humans have spent tens of thousands of years perfecting: natural language.

Matt Buck, CTO of local conversational interface agency Voxable and a Google Developer Expert for the Assistant platform, will demonstrate ways to drive business value with Dialogflow. By examining a few examples of engaging conversational experiences and how they are built with Dialogflow, you'll leave with an understanding of how to help your users better achieve their goals.

This month, Volusion HR is sponsoring the venue, food, and drinks. They will talk for a few minutes about current opportunities. So, polish up those CVs. :-)

Note: Please provide your full name upon RSVP'ing. This will help us with attendance. Thanks!
events.how_to_find_us: We're at the corner of Kramer and Boyer. There's plenty of free parking. Please sign in at the front.

events.name: Introduction to Event Streams and Highlights from Google Next!
events.description:
Title: Introduction to Event Streams, a Google Perspective

Description: In this session, EJ Vincent, a member of the customer engineering group working on Google Cloud Platform, will provide an introduction to event stream architecture theory and principles. Specifically, he’ll be covering examples of open source technologies and Google Cloud-based services that can be used to facilitate and encourage the adoption of event streams.

This event is hosted by RetailMeNot. Their HR will be present talking about their current openings—bring your resumes if you're interested.

The Meetup will be hosted at RetailMeNot’s office. Parking:
* Please park in the Frost Bank Tower (guest parking) accessible from 4th Street. We will provide parking vouchers. Walk over to 301 Congress and head to the 4th Floor.
events.how_to_find_us: Park in the Frost Bank Tower Guest Parking by entering from 4th Street. Walk across 4th Street between the two buildings and enter 301 Congress. Go to the 4th floor.

events.name: Tensor Processing Units (TPUs): Accelerating Deep Learning
events.description:
GCP Gurus,

We're delighted to announce that our next meetup will be next Weds (2018/10/10) at 6:30 PM. Hallie Crosby from Google will discuss accelerating deep learning using TPUs on GCP.

Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are hardware accelerators that greatly speed up the training of deep learning models. In independent tests conducted by Stanford University, the ResNet-50 model trained on a TPU was the fastest (30 minutes) to reach the desired accuracy on the ImageNet dataset. In this talk, she'll walk you through why you would use TPUs and an overview of the hardware. She will also show examples of state-of-the-art models for valuable use cases and provide details of how you could adapt your own model for TPU training.

Google is paying for pizza and drinks. There is plenty of parking.

Location:
Volusion, LLC (https://maps.google.com/maps?q=1835%20Kramer%20Lane%2C%20Austin%2C%20TX)
1835A Kramer Lane Suite 100, Austin, TX

We look forward to seeing you there,

-- Jason
events.how_to_find_us: We're at the corner or Kramer Ln and Boyer Ln. Easy peasy.

events.name: Armory.io Presents Spinnaker!
events.description:
GCP Gurus,

We have a special treat in store to kick off our 2019 GDG Cloud Austin meetup series: Armory.io is flying in speakers to present to us about Spinnaker. We'll get an introduction to Spinnaker as well as how to use it with Kubernetes.

The first confirmed speaker is Ethan Rogers. Ethan is a Senior Software Engineer at Armory.io and a core committer to the Spinnaker OSS project. At Armory, Ethan is responsible for ensuring the success of open source by leading technical initiatives, like the Kubernetes SIG, and evangelizing Spinnaker in the community.

Ethan will cover Spinnaker basics and do a live demo that highlights some of Spinnaker’s core functionality such as baking machine images, creating pipelines, and deploying artifacts to Kubernetes.

The second speaker will soon be confirmed.

Google is sponsoring pizza and drinks! There will be plenty of parking. Space is limited so RSVP early.

Location:
Volusion, LLC (https://maps.google.com/maps?q=1835%20Kramer%20Lane%2C%20Austin%2C%20TX)
1835A Kramer Lane Suite 100, Austin, TX

We look forward to seeing you there,

-- Jason
events.how_to_find_us: We're at the corner or Kramer Ln and Boyer Ln. Easy peasy.

events.name: gRPC with Ryan Richard, Customer Engineer in Google Cloud
events.description:
GCP Gurus,

This month we're lucky enough to have Ryan Richard, Customer Engineer in Google Cloud, talk about gRPC.

gRPC is a high-performance, open-source universal RPC framework developed by Google and lives at the center of all Google services. During this meetup we'll be giving a brief overview of gRPC, who's adopting it and demo it by building out a service. By the end we'd like to convince the audience that gRPC is worth investigating for their next API.

Google is sponsoring food and drinks! There will be plenty of parking. Space is limited so RSVP early.

Location:
Volusion, LLC
1835A Kramer Lane Suite 100, Austin, TX

https://maps.google.com/maps?q=1835%20Kramer%20Lane%2C%20Austin%2C%20TX

We look forward to seeing you there,

-- Victor

VP Engineering and Data Science at Volusion
